3: Huh? Wait—this isn’t the train car?

13: That ticket with the black vine patterns and

15: Without it, I can never get back on the train…
16: What will I do now…?  I guess I’ll just wait here…
maybe the next train will find me.

18: Once I sit down, the drowsiness washes over me…
like the tide… sweeping me away…

22: Is the train coming to pick me up?
24: I was just talking to you earlier…
but it feels like such a long time has passed since then…
25: “Do I remember where I lost the ticket”…?
Hmm… not really… it’s all a blur now…
26: It’s not heavy like the coins in this world…
It’s light—lighter than a swan’s feather~
27: Its color looks like a ‘sleeping lake’ frozen inside it,
and if you hold it to the light, you can see stardust flowing within~
29: Maybe in a field full of blue sage,
or taken by a fearless fox back to its den,
30: or perhaps… it turned into the first drop of morning dew,
31: I have no idea what she’s talking about…)
32: I’m sorry… the only thing I can recall,
33: I used to love reading this back on the train too...
34: It’s filled with lots of... interesting notes...
I think it might be useful for you as well, adventurer...
38: something I definitely shouldn’t have seen…)
